sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Houshold talke or, Good councell for a married man Deliuered in a prittie dialogue, by Roger a batchelor, to Simon, a (iealous) married-man. To the tune of Buckle and thong-a. M. P. (Martin Parker), d. 1656?
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill.
printed for the assignes of Thomas Simcocks, and are to bee sold by Francis Grove, dwelling vpon Snow-hill, London : [1629]
Signed: M. P., i.e. Martin Parker. In two parts; woodcuts at head of each part. STC has publication date 1628-1629. Verse - "Neighbor Roger woe is me,". Reproductions of the original in the British Library.
=======
Houshold talke or, Good councell for a married man Deliuered in a prittie dialogue, by Roger a batchelor, to Simon, a (iealous) married-man. To the tune of Buckle and thong-a. M. P. (Martin Parker), d. 1656?
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill.
printed for the assignes of Thomas Simcocks, and are to bee sold by Francis Grove, dwelling vpon Snow-hill, London : [1629]
Signed: M. P., i.e. Martin Parker. In two parts; woodcuts at head of each part. STC has publication date 1628-1629. Verse - "Neighbor Roger woe is me,". Reproductions of the original in the British Library.
Francis Grove
Thomas Simcocks
Snow-hill
